projects: [{'title': '48 Hour Film Project Nijmegen', 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}}, 'description': "The 48 Hour Film Project is a wild and sleepless weekend in which several teams make a write, shoot and edit movie in just 48 hours. On Friday night, the teams draw a genre from a hat. They are given a character, prop and line to include in their films as well. On Sunday night, in a wild dash to the drop off event, the film is turned in. I was the producer of team Valky's short movie 'Kriele Intenties'.", 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Mandy', 'last_name': 'Duijn', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Freelance Journalist & Researcher | DuMa Mediaproducties'}]}, {'title': '2116.eu', 'date': {'start': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'description': 'Hundred years of kinship: 2016-2116. Thirty energetic and competent realistic idealists with a shared quest to find what it means to be ‘united in diversity’. In a collective action-based-research for kinship; thinking for the doing. Nomadic community-building that crystalizes in events, visual and textual publications. I was connected to this initiative as editor and publicist on Eastern Europe. ', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Mandy', 'last_name': 'Duijn', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Freelance Journalist & Researcher | DuMa Mediaproducties'}]}, {'title': 'Andere Achterhuizen', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}}, 'description': 'As one of the volunteers of the oral history research project Andere Achterhuizen, I have interviewed Jewish people in the Netherlands about their memories of a life in hiding during the Second World War. I wrote down their stories. These stories are published on an interactive website. ', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Mandy', 'last_name': 'Duijn', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Freelance Journalist & Researcher | DuMa Mediaproducties'}]}]

In this 20 part documentary series, the VPRO and Geert Mak travel together through Europe and European history again. The new series picks up where the last one ended: in 1999. The optimism during the turn of the century was soon replaced by feelings of fear and confusion after the 9/11 attacks, the credit crisis, an increasing flow of refugees and a deteriorating relationship with Russia. But is it possible to recognise history when you're in the middle of it? And when nobody knows how it will end? 

Episodes I've worked on include "de pop van Poetin", "zwijgen als het graf", "aan de goede kant van de geschiedenis", "de krekel en de mier", "dansende beren", "je geld of je leven" and "here come's 'trouble'".', 'title': 'Researcher In Europa', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 1743233, 'name': 'Omroep Human', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQEGMAIBPBSztw/company-logo_400_400/0/1545059569668?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=guaIo5zIzxTOuYwagpHzwlZ-msyp8s1O3wAMUSNydSQ', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/omroep-human/', 'employees': {'start': 51, 'end': 200}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Amsterdam en omgeving, Nederland', 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'company': 'Omroep Human', 'description': 'Research for Dus Ik Volg.
